Budget book confirms that Ministers so-called corporate tax reform proposals will generate grand total of €0 million, yes zero!(see below). ie absolutely no closing of tax loop-holes for corporates or serious anti-avoidance measures #Budget19 @rtenews @NewstalkFM @IrishMirror https://t.co/3RZic1sLjp

No specific measures to close huge home-grown corporate tax loop-holes identified by C&AG €219 billion in allowances & losses forward. Nothing to close scandal of section 110 tax breaks for property speculators - just generalities about reform. #Budget19 @rtenews @NewstalkFM

@rtenews Despite spin, output targets for new social housing announced almost exactly the same as in re-building Ireland. So no departure from plan that is failing &only €270 million more than previously announced & most will be gobbled up by private landlords in HAPs

Extra funding for housing was almost all announced already in the NDP, half of additional over & above is going on HAP. Re-building Ireland promised 9540 new social homes, Minister has only increased it to 10,000 ie 460 extra units - Pathetic ! #Budget19 @rtenews @NewstalkFM

People power victory! one day of protest by tenants at Beacon South Quarter against shocking 20-30% rent hikes by IRES-Reit & IRES backed down. Tenants contacted today-rent hikes withdrawn. But loophole they exploited must be closed down urgently @rtenews @NewstalkFM @pb4p https://t.co/3zl1lLG8Bq

This is shocking! Tenants in Sandyford of IRES-Reit, biggest landlord in country, got letters demanding 20-30% rent increase from €2,200 a month to €2800+ in apts IRES bought from NAMA, using loop-holes in 4% rent cap law. FG allow this, that’s why we have #HousingCrisis https://t.co/76BAh8xYoi
